website_summaries.verdict: One of the best full-frame cameras to take high-res photos without the bulk of a DSLR body. Performs well with photos and videos.
pros: This camera's compact profile and design helps it fit into small bags
4K-recording capabilities can take full advantage of the full-frame sensor to capture greater detail
cons: The LCD screen only rotates up and down, limiting its usefulness when taking angled shots

customer_reviews.title: What an easy camera to use
customer_reviews.text: What an easy camera to use. Such a beauty. And what a Black Friday deal. £719 and another £100 in cashback coming - so full frame for an astonishing £619 all in - with 28-70 lens. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Charles McConnochie

customer_reviews.title: A7 in 2019? Yes, please!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one as base replacement for my previous A6000. I was looking for something reasonably priced but with full frame sensor and better light sensitivity than my old camera. If You are, just like myself, a hobbyist and You need reliable and quality camera, this one is just tailored for You. Only drawback I've noticed so far are lenses. Usually, more expensive than APS-C versions, so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Slawek

customer_reviews.title: Don't focus on this
customer_reviews.text: Hyped up garbage, my spare A6000 could eat this alive, its a shockingly bad camera. I bought this when it first was released, I only purchased again as it was an Amazon warehouse deal and I made a decent profit on it, other than that use your phone lol.
customer_reviews.author: Picard

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant camera
customer_reviews.text: Really love using this camera which has all the toys you could need built in. Kit lens is ok, not of the same quality as the body but does a job and the replacement lenses do come at quite a price. I've had no issues with battery life and picture quality is great. Very pleased with this and I managed to get it at a fairly good price. I'm really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs M Price

customer_reviews.title: Top Camera
customer_reviews.text: First Sony Camera from Nikon, love the build, need a mount to make it more comfortable to hold but as full frame cameras go this is a great gateway camera. The battery life is dreadful, nothing in comparison to the Nikon, would say is holds 1/5th maybe less than a Nikon battery but they are cheap to buy spares. Lenses are expensive so don't buy if you are starting off Photography, this camera is not simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: James Bessey

customer_reviews.title: Camera is great but Sony Customer service is bad as always
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as it was a great deal with 150 cashback, but when I claim for a cashback with sony they just declined my request by saying that the reciept dosen't have my name on it but in fact it has my name in front of the company name I work for, this is extremely dissappointing, there is nothing wrong with the camera but sony customer service is always been bad.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav Singh

customer_reviews.title: Great value semi- pro camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant little camera, which compares well to my D800. Perfect for using vintage lenses via adapters. I also use it for video work in low light situations, for which it performs admirably. The kit lens is absolutely fine for most applications - ignore any of the bored that tell you otherwise. Had to overcome the battery usage issue with a battery grip - purchased this year also using the Cashback scheme. Yes it’s an older camera design but it is fantastic value for money, especially if you take the Sony Cashback scheme into account.
customer_reviews.author: Sony user

customer_reviews.title: This has broken a 45-year Nikon habit for me
customer_reviews.text: ... so it has to have something going for it. Lockdown has limited my ability to use it. Likes: image quality, super-intuitive menu. Worries: changing lenses does not give you the same sense of positive engagement as Nikon DSLRs. I would probably not have bought at full price, but as a Black Friday deal - and I immediately upgraded from the standard lens - I have nothing to complain about. Buy a second battery; you will need one.,
customer_reviews.author: Ted Schrecker

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good intro to full frame
customer_reviews.text: Love it. New to full frame photography this has been an ideal intro. I got this on the summer Sony cashback deal so it was a steal. I guess it will soon be discontinued as the line is now on mark 3/4 but in the meantime this is an ideal way of getting into full frame photography.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Delighted

customer_reviews.title: Amazing piece of kit at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: Best digital camera I've ever owned, by far. Now my old Carl Zeiss T* lenses, 50/1.7 Planar and 100/3.5 Sonnar, are now back in use. Not really for novices or photographers with poor camera handling technique given the lack of stabilization. One wonders how great photographers like Henri Cartier-Bresson ever survived! And I'd say it's a waste of money for anyone just wanting to use automatically produced jpeg images. What's the point of owning a full frame camera like this if you aren't going to exploit its RAW image potential?
